column3: founded in [[1983]]. Their first games were puzzles (hence the name) and board games
column4: but they later settled on trading card games. After losing the rights to ''Star Wars'' in 2001
column5: they quickly found a replacement: [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (film series)]]. Their popular ''[[The Lord of the Rings Trading Card Game]]'' - usually referred to as "Decipher Cards" - lasted until [[2007]]

column2: Decipher also ran the ''[[The Lord of the Rings Fan Club]]''
column3: and in [[2002]] they published ''[[The Lord of the Rings Roleplaying Game]]''.
